Pre-Game Insights: Washington aims to break its three-game slide with a victory against Philadelphia.
The 76ers are 11-10 in conference games. Philadelphia is 2-1 in games decided by 3 points or fewer.
The Wizards are 5-17 in Eastern Conference play. Washington has a 2-26 record in games decided by 10 or more points.
The 76ers are shooting 44.7% from the field this season, 2.6 percentage points lower than the 47.3% the Wizards allow to opponents.
The Wizards' 44.6% shooting percentage from the field this season is 3.4 percentage points lower than the 76ers have given up to their opponents (48.0%).
Tyrese Maxey is scoring 25.4 points per game with 3.3 rebounds and 5.6 assists for the 76ers.
Bilal Coulibaly is shooting 42.9% and averaging 12.8 points for the Wizards.

In their last 10 games, the 76ers are 6-4, averaging 110.9 points, 39.3 rebounds, 22.7 assists, 10.7 steals and 4.4 blocks per game while shooting 45.7% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 111.3 points per game.

In their last 10 games, the Wizards are 3-7, averaging 113.5 points, 46.2 rebounds, 27.0 assists, 7.0 steals and 5.0 blocks per game while shooting 46.2% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 120.5 points.
Others: Injuries for the 76ers: Joel Embiid (foot), Jared McCain (meniscus), Andre Drummond (toe), Kyle Lowry (hip), Paul George (groin), KJ Martin (foot).
Injuries for the Wizards: Saddiq Bey (knee), Jordan Poole (hip), Marvin Bagley III (knee), Malcolm Brogdon (foot), Kyle Kuzma (calf).
